availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: Frederick Augustus Palmer (Essex County, New Jersey, servant and clerk.)

body.p: Newark, Essex County, New Jersey, clerk. Essex County, New Jersey, native. Son of William S. Palmer and Harriet S. Palmer. Resident of Newark, Essex County, New Jersey in 1850. Resident of Newark, Essex County, New Jersey in 1860. Civilian clerk in the U.S. Army's Quarter Master's Department at Camp Nelson, Kentucky in 1863.

ab.bibl:
Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, New Jersey, Essex County, Newark/East Ward, p. 123B.
Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, New Jersey, Essex County, Newark/Ward 4, p. 461.
"The Way of the Transgressor," The Post (Camden, NJ), May 29, 1885, p. 1.
KYR-0001-003-0037.
